record the place of the first
political meeting. Even the saga
and epic tales of valiant men
ignore the exploits of the political
figure of that particular era.


In this period of transformation
it comes. In this change from
summer to autumn it appears.
1t rears its shape early in the
summer and rises to its fullness
during July and August at ma
tional conventions. September
arrives and the CLEAN in the eyes
of all dedicated men who have
proclaimed themselves the
chosen turn not toward Mecca,
but to the ballot box or voters
booth.


Sociologists have attempted to
evaluate the political surround
ings of man. They have care
fully put man in the social order
and endowed him with certain
desires, including food. water,
shelter. and a society to live
within.


Once upon a time. long ago
before man learned that he could
voice his opinion. A very strong
man overcame the huge beast
which had terrorized his village.
All other men gave him some
gifts and a string of animal
claws and teeth we're strung
around his neck to distinguish
him from the other men of the
village.


All was we'll until younger
and more virile man killed three
beasts. He gave some Of the
teeth and claws to his brothers,
who met and formed his council.
Thus, began the first political
party under the guise Of brother
ly love.


The title of chief was passed
from father to son or to his
brother if he had only mere girls.
More councils we're organized in
the same village. Finally, all of
the councils met and decided to
form one, big happy council. Each
council would be unable to meet
regularly and it was agreed that
one man would represent the
council in the big meeting.


To tell the representatives
from the other village men, they
would wear more claws plus
feather band. They would look
for a sign from the wise man
usually the politicking strong
mans father in law. The wise
man would draw mysterious pic
lures. fall into frances, innovate
weird dances and chant unknown
phrases.


After years of power and pres
tige, the chief became weary Of
his own great council. Times
we're easy and there we're few
beasts to kill. The families had
all stopped feuding and even the
young men we're becoming fat and
tame.


The wise man and the politician
chief met secretly to devise a
plan which would start war with
a nearby community. The plan
succeeded and the chief annexed
the next village. At last, several
villages we're under the control
of those conniving men and their
trusted aides.


No longer did beasts invade the
villages and the chief had tokeep
some controversies brewing so
the council could meet and have
problems to discuss. Once a
lesser chief disagreed and he
was ordered to leave the land.
The seller chief surprised the
council by uttering his refusal
